greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Self-inverse permutation of natural numbers: a(0) = 0, a(1) = 1, and for n > 1, if A065620(n) < 0, a(n) = A065621(1+a(-(A065620(n)))), otherwise a(n) = A048724(a(A065620(n)-1)).
comment: This is an instance of entanglement permutation, where complementary pair A048724/A065621 is entangled with the same pair in the opposite order: A065621/A048724, with a(1) set to 1.
Note how this is A193231-conjugate of A054429.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2047
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: a(0) = 0, a(1) = 1, and for n > 1, if A010060(n) = 0, a(n) = A065621(1+a(A246159(n))), otherwise a(n) = A048724(a(A246160(n)-1)). [Note how A246159 is an inverse function for A048724, while A246160 is an inverse function for A065621].
As a composition of related permutations:
program: (Scheme, with memoizing-macro definec, two equivalent definitions)
return n if n<2 else a065621(1 + a(-x)) if x<0 else a048724(a(x - 1))
print([a(n) for n in range(101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 07 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 20 2014
